name: Here Comes Team Rocket!

historicalClassification.note: Originally printed as a Trainer. Would be classified as Supporter by modern rules due to significant game state change affecting both players.

effect.text: Each player plays with his or her Prize cards face up for the rest of the game.

tips: Play early to maximize information advantage
Helps you know exactly what cards are prized
Can help plan which Pokemon to knock out for specific prizes
Both players benefit, so use when you gain more advantage

competitiveHistory: Here Comes Team Rocket! was a unique information card. Revealing all Prize cards for both players eliminated the hidden information aspect of prizes. While symmetric (both players see prizes), the player who plays it typically has a plan to benefit from the information. It saw niche play in decks that wanted to track prize cards or plan knockouts strategically.

rulings.ruling: Once played, Prize cards remain face-up for the rest of the game - there's no way to turn them face-down again.
This effect persists even if the card that caused it is no longer in play.
Both players' Prize cards are revealed simultaneously.
